listitem.para: Freshman EngineerFEST, occurs around the second week of classes. The point of this event is to spark interest in joining ACM to incoming freshman. The chair of the club will most likely receive an email about booking a table for Freshman EngineerFEST. If they don't, then be sure to ask around Freshman Engineering. Be sure to bring a sign up sheet so that new students can jot down their emails. It's also a good idea to bring an info sheet so that students can read a little bit more about the clubs and check out our site. Make a big poster if you have time.

First Meeting, the first meeting is listed because it sets the tone for the rest of the semester. More people are going to come to this meeting than any other meeting. This meeting should occur soon following Freshman EngineerFEST. Follow meeting protocol and everything will be great. Be sure to re-iterate what the club is about and have a banging speaker for this meeting.
Big Event, historically, ACM/FSG has a large event in Spring around February. It usually takes up to this point to have planned and coordinated with a speaker to get them here.

Officer Election, it is very important that officer elections occur before the end of the Spring semester so that everyone isn't busy with their finals and can't attent the election. This happened in Spring 2011. It is also important to elect a group at this time so that they can plan and get to know eachother over the Summer months.

Annual Reports w/ ACM Headquarters, late in the Spring semster usually the club chair will get an email from the department asking them to manage the annual report. This report includes several sections including current officers (all of which must be registered with the ACM to be credited), finances (records should have been kept), current members (a list should have been maintained), and upcoming events (brainstorm). To access the annual report, contact the faculty advisor of the ACM.
